label: 櫃
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: Large chests for storage are called hitsu and were used to store the objects in the Shōsō-in. Those with four or six legs are referred to as karabitsu (Chinese chests), while those without legs that sit directly on the ground are known as wabitsu (Japanese chests). [正倉院、唐櫃、和櫃]
